summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The VMRALPHABITMAP structure is used in the VMR-7 filter's methods when the application is providing a static alpha-blended bitmap to be displayed on the composited video frame.
Flags that instruct the mixer where to find the bitmap. The following values are defined.

listheader.description: Disable the bitmap. This flag cannot be combined with other flags.

Obtain the bitmap from the HDC. If this flag is set, the hdc member must specify a valid handle to a device context, and the pDDS member must be NULL.
If this flag is absent, the pDDS member must point to a valid DirectDraw surface, and the hdc member must be NULL.
Take the entire DirectDraw surface. When this flag is specified, rSrc is ignored. This flag cannot be combined with the VMRBITMAP_HDC flag.
The clrSrcKey value is valid and should be used when blending.

Indicates that the rSrc rectangle is valid and specifies a sub-rectangle of the original app image to be blended.
This flag is only valid for the method. For the method, the rSrc member must refer to the entire bitmap.

member.name: VMRALPHABITMAP.hdc
member.summary: The handle to the device context for the bitmap. Specify NULL if the bitmap is located in a DirectDraw surface.

member.name: VMRALPHABITMAP.pDDS
member.summary: Pointer to a DirectDraw surface that contains the bitmap. Specify NULL if the bitmap is to be obtained from a GDI device context. If a DirectDraw surface is specified, the pixel format must be ARGB-32 or RGB-32. If the surface contains per-pixel alpha, do not set the VMRBITMAP_SRCCOLORKEY flag in dwFlags.

member.name: VMRALPHABITMAP.rSrc
member.summary: Specifies the source rectangle in either the GDI device context or the DirectDraw surface.

member.name: VMRALPHABITMAP.rDest
member.summary: Specifies the destination rectangle in composition space.

member.name: VMRALPHABITMAP.fAlpha
member.summary: Specifies the alpha blending value; must be a value from 0.0 to 1.0 (inclusive).
